pageContext.claim: “I will say that I.G., the Inspector General Horowitz, he -- other than his conclusion, where he said no bias, but he meant that in a different way than you would think -- he gave a great report last time.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump mischaracterizes the inspector general's conclusion after its review of anti-Trump text messages between FBI officials Peter Strzok and Lisa Page. The inspector general criticized the FBI officials for sending the messages and eroding public trust. But there was no evidence of political bias in their investigative decisions during the 2016 race, the inspector general concluded. "We did not find documentary or testimonial evidence that improper considerations, including political bias, directly affected the specific investigative decisions we reviewed," the report says.
